The services offered in her repair shop include flat tire repair, spare parts repair, motorcycle engine repair, etc. Meiske also sells lubricant, spare parts, tires, etc. She dreams of improving the business, and therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000 to buy more stock such as tires, lubricant, bolts, etc.

loans.use: to buy more business stock, i.e., tires, lubricant, bolts, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 37-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for eight years. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house, and going back to school for further education. His business goal are buying land to grow crops and setting up a retail shop. Julius wants this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. She has been a teacher for 21 years. Her hardship is high fuel and transportation costs, and her personal goal is educating her children. She wants this loan to pay medical bills.

loans.use: To pay medical bills

loans.name: Sayuni

texts.en: Sayuni wants a loan to buy drugs to sell in her veterinary shop. She is a 51-year-old, hard-working married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her seven children. Her husband saved money from his salary and started a pharmacy. Price fluctuations coupled with inadequate capital hinder her business. Her desire is to educate her children and buy a motorcycle while her business goal is to diversify her business to include farming and to move the business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in her veterinary shop.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared wants a loan to buy soft drinks to sell. He is a 44-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his two children, and his desire is to see them graduate with degrees. He runs a bar, and the business is very lucrative despite the challenges of theft, customers not paying on time, and the wet seasons that hinder his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran is a 20-year-old student at Azerbaijan Technology University. He is in his third year of education in the Standardizing and Technology Machines program. He is not working, and his father and two brothers have jobs and have already paid for the second year of his education. Kamran's family has some financial difficulties, and Kamran is requesting a loan to pay for his education fees for his second and third years. He is requesting 1000 AZN.  The main advantage of loan is that it will be easier for his family to pay, and secondly, in Azerbaijan, education fees must be paid a year in advance.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Araceli Monserreate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Aracely, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 20, 18 -14 y 5 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela, todos ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo realiza trabajos para una empresa constructora.

Nuestra amiga tiene un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son seguir en su trabajo y que nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the communal bank of Amigas de Tosagua meet twice a month. This place is known for being very dynamic where most of the people work in agriculture and animal husbandry, and for being an area of great vegetation.

Here we meet Aracely, who is 39 years old, married and from this relationship she has 4 children who are 20, 18, 14 and 5 years old. The older two are studying at university and the younger are school students. They all live together with her. Her husband works for a construction company.

Our friend has a little sewing workshop where she makes all types of clothing for women, men, and children, although what she most likes to make is clothing for women. She takes individual work orders but makes uniforms for institutions, and neighborhood schools at fixed intervals. She works every day from 6:00AM until 7:00PM and at times until even later when she has orders to deliver. She has been in this business for fifteen years and she is doing pretty well.

She will use this new loan to buy fabrics, thread and other sewing materials. She is a founding member of the communal bank, collects payments for it, and she likes it because of the help it gives her in order to get ahead.

Her dreams are to continue working and that she always has orders for work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Washington William

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a don Washington, tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  14 y 12 años  de edad, ambos  estudian en colegio. Su esposa se dedica al hogar.

Nuestro amigo para ganarse la vida y para que a su familia no le falte nada se dedica a realizar fletes en una moto taxi, vehículo que es muy utilizado en este cantón por las personas para trasladarse de un lugar a otro,  él trabaja todos los días en su moto y también en ocasiones trabaja con un pariente realizando trabajos de limpieza en una camaronera, lleva con su moto taxi mas de 12 años y le va muy bien gracias y a esto consigue lo necesario para solventar los gastos de hogar.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ciertos repuestos para su moto taxi y así brindar un mejor servicio, lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho cuando lo ha necesitado.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro y así brindad un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Tosagua” (Friends of Tosagua) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry; it is a zone with much vegetation.

We met Washington, 46, here.  He’s married and has two children who are 14 and 12 years old; both attend secondary school.  His wife is a housewife.

To earn his livelihood and so that his family will lack nothing, our friend does transportation in a mototaxi, a vehicle that’s very utilized in this canton by people to get from one place to another.  He works with his moto every day and occasionally works with a relative cleaning in a shrimp processing plant.  He’s been with his mototaxi more than 12 years and does very well; thanks to this he earns what’s necessary to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy certain spare parts for his mototaxi to provide better service that way.  He’s been in the communal bank for five cycles and likes it because the loans have helped him very much when he most needed it.  His dream is to buy a car to provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  uno de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo tiene una carnicería.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito tanto para su esposo como para su negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su trabajo.  Su esposo también tiene una carnicería en el mercado local donde vende carne de chanco y de res, negocio que él tiene por más de 15 años, nos cuenta que él se desplaza a los campos a comprar los chanchos en pie y luego los lleva a los centros de faenamiento para luego llevar la carne  a su local.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar chanchos para la carnicería y víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Tosagua” (Friends of Tosagua) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry; it is a zone with much vegetation.

We met María, 56, in this place.  She’s married and has three adult children; one of them still lives with her.  Her husband has a butcher shop.

Our friend is taking out the loan both for her husband and for her business; she has a small, home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of foodstuffs in addition to legumes, vegetables and fruit.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later; her son helps her with her work.  Her husband also has a butcher shop in the local market where he sells pork and beef, a business he’s had for more than 15 years.  She tells us that he heads out to the countryside to buy live pigs that he takes to the slaughterhouses to later take meat to his shop.

She will use this loan to buy pigs for the butcher shop and groceries to stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because she’s made friendships in the group.  Her goal is to continue moving forward in her business and that the store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy pigs and groceries.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en: Sadress is a 31-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.The responsibility of looking after the family rests solely on her because her husband does not have any sustained employment. She is a teacher, and she has been teaching for six years. Her personal goals are educating her children and setting up an income-generating activity to supplement her income. Sadress wants this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Shahmar

texts.en: Shahmar is a 21-year-old student at Azerbaijan Technology University. He entered the university in 2008 and will graduate this year. He is in the Food Product Technology and Tourism program. His dream is to become a specialist in this profession and to earn his MBA. Shahmar is not working, hence his parents pay his education fees.  He is requesting a loan of 1200 AZN to pay tuition for his final year of college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his final year of college

loans.name: Emmanueline

texts.en: Emmanueline is a 38-year-old, hard-working married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a health information assistant for six years. Her personal goals are to educate her children up to the university level and to start up a drug shop to supplement her salary. Emmanueline wants this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 35-year-old single mother of one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a policewoman for twenty years, and she is proud to be part of keeping the peace and law enforcement. Her personal goals are educating her child and building a permanent house. Daisy wants this loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee and banana plantation.

loans.name: Daicy Yaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Deicy tiene 34 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  17 y 10 de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, de dos a tres horas diarias sobretodo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y fue su hermana quien la invito al grupo y ahora está muy a gusto con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Amigas de Todagua communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This area is known for being very dynamic where most of the residents farm and raise livestock as this is an area of great vegetation.


Deicy lives here.  She’s 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 17 and 10.  They attend school.  Her husband is a mason.
 

Our friend is a housewife.  She sells clothing in order to generate an income of her own and help her husband with the household expenses.  She also does catalog sales of Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She works three days a week, two to three hours a day, especially in the mornings.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for ten years and things are going well for her.


This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and undergarments.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  Her sister was the one who started the group and now she is very comfortable with the loans.


Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de  8 y 7  años de edad y un bebito de 2 meses de nacido, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Lleva cinco años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos ya que así sale adelante sola con sus hijos.

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo, nos comenta que es así como ella sale adelante y le gusta ya que allí también les ayuda a sus pequeños en sus tareas y  no los descuida y mucho menos al pequeñito que requiere de muchos cuidados. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto no les falta nada ni a ella ni a sus pequeños hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Tosagua” (Friends of Tosagua) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry; it is a zone with much vegetation.

We met Rosa, 25, in this place.  She’s a single mother of three children, an 8-year-old, a seven-year-old and a two-month-old baby; the two older ones attend school.   She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help the loans provide since she’s getting ahead alone with her children.

In order to get ahead with her family, our friend has a home-based grocery store where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables and fruit.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later; her children help her with her work.  She tells us that this is how she gets ahead and she likes it because she can help her children with their homework there and even more can care for her littlest one who needs much care.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years and thanks to it neither she nor her children lack anything.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help she always gets from the group.  Her goal is to continue moving forward and that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a fifty one-year-old widowed woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop that sells general merchandise such as sugar, soap, and cooking oil among others, and has been in business for more than 10 years. Her main dream is to expand her business into new markets and venture into other enterprises.  Faith needs the loan to buy cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell. He is a married man living in Masindi, Uganda, and he is charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. He deals in spare parts, and the business has been very lucrative. He has been able to pay his children's school fees and renovate his house with his proceeds. Inadequate capital to purchase stock hinders his business, and his desire is to move his business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Sharon has been working hard to manage a stationary business where she sells books and pens. 

Sharon is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to help expand her business, and purchase more items, such as books, to sell. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and expand her store. In the future, she hopes to construct commercial houses. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as books, to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 42-year-old married man with ten children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the past three years, he has been raising poultry. Wilson's chief business challenges are price fluctuation, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and inadequate capital. 

Wilson is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to diversify his business and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Baluku

texts.en:
Baluku is a forty-two-year-old gentle man who has been running a retail shop for a period of two years. He started as a fishmonger then got capital to start a retail shop. Inadequate capital is affecting the business since customers have different tastes and demands. He has personal goals of building a permanent house and expanding his business to new markets. 

Baluku wants a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for eleven years and she says that she is satisfied with her service since most of her students are prospering. Her hardship is high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goal is educating her children. Joseline wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a fifty-three-year-old gentle man married with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for seven years. He would like to educate his children and build a permanent house.

Dan wants a loan to process a land title for his land.

loans.use: to process a land title for his land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-two-year-old lady with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She works as a community development officer with a sub-county and has done this work for two and a half years. 

She wishes to have her children educated and educate herself as well, and buy land for developments. She says inadequate capital is affecting her plans for prosperity. Mary wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Maria Cleotilde

texts.es:
La señora María vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus 2 hijos los cuales le apoyan en su actividad. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil acceso ya que esta en el centro de la ciudad, y esto hace que sea muy visitado. El crédito lo necesita para  comprar: frijoles, carnes, azúcar, embutidos, pollo, verduras, arroz, aceite, refrescos etc. De esta manera darle un buen servicio a su clientela. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es satisfacer los pedidos a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que podrá tener una variedad de producto, y así  contrarrestar la demanda diaria de sus productos ya que por la calidad tiene bastantes pedidos todos los días.
Los planes a futuro de Doña María es hacer crecer su negocio,  llegar a tener un restaurante y  de igual manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, honduras – Abril del 2012
texts.en:
María lives in the southern part of Honduras. Her two children live with her, and they support her in her work. Her business is located in an easily accesible spot downtown, so it gets lots of customers. 
She needs the loan in order to purchase beans, meat, sugar, sausages, chicken, vegetables, rice, oil, soft drinks, etc. This will allow her to give her customers good service.
She hopes the financing to impact her business by enabling her to fill all of her customers' orders, since she will be able to have a great variety of products and meet daily demand. Due to the good quality of her products, she gets quite a few orders every day.
María's plan for the future is to expand her business and some day open a restaurant, so that she can have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase beans, meat, sugar, sausages, chicken, vegetables, rice, oil, soft drinks, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupado, pero por lo general es nuestra amiga la que mas pasa en su negocio ya que nos comenta que es allí donde le gusta estar porque  además de ganarse la vida también está al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños. Tiene ocho años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda además porque los intereses son muy bajos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Tosagua” (Friends of Tosagua) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry; it is a zone with much vegetation.

Viviana, 28, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 8 and 5 years old and attending school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Our friend has a grocery store at home.  She sells all types of products there like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables and fruit.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her husband helps her with her work when he’s not busy but in general it’s our friend who spends most of her time at her store since she comments that that’s where she likes to be because besides earning a living she’s also watching over her children’s needs.  She’s been in business 8 years and does very well.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help and because interest rates are very low.  Her goal is to continue forward with her business and that the store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Bernardita Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bernardina, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 18, 13, 9 y 2 años de edad, dos de ellos  estudian en colegio y otro en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y ahora con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, sabanas, almohadas y todo la que sus clientes le pidan, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la agricultura, el siembra arroz y verduras.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar insumos agrícolas para su esposo y telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez que salen los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Tosagua” (Friends of Tosagua) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most of its residents work in farming and animal husbandry; it is a zone with much vegetation.

We met Bernardina, 42, in this place.  She’s married and has four children who are 18, 13, 9 and 2 years old; two of them attend secondary school and one is in elementary school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

She learned dressmaking at a local academy and now in order to earn her own income and taking advantage of her dressmaking skills she set up a small workshop at home where she makes all type of clothes, sheets, pillows and whatever else her customers request.  She works on order from individuals and seasonally also makes uniforms for local institutions, schools and high-schools.  She works every day from 6am until 10pm and sometimes even later when she has pending orders to deliver.  She will also give part of her loan to her husband so that he can use it in agriculture; he grows rice and vegetables.

She will use this new loan to buy farm supplies for her husband and fabric, thread and other supplies for the sewing.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes it because of the speed of the loans.  Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business and with her family life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a forty-three-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been trading in bananas and coffee for eight years. His hardship is price fluctuation and inflation, his personal goal is educating his children, and his business goal is buying land to grow crops. Vincent wants money to buy coffee and bananas for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 20 years old and a student at Azerbaijan Technology University. He entered university in 2009 and will complete his studies in 2013. Vusal is a third year student and is in the food products, technology, and tourism department. His dream is to specialize in this profession and obtain his MBA. Vusal is not currently working because his studies take all of his time. His parents are paying for his education.

Vusal is requesting a 1700 AZN loan to pay next year's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a thirty-five-year-old lady with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She works as a teacher with Kagadi secondary school and has been in service for a period of six years. She wishes to educate her children and build a permanent home as well and buy land for developments. She says inadequate capital is affecting her development plans.

Harriet wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul wants a loan to help weed and harvest his crops. He is aged 53 and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of eight children. He is a farmer who started as a subsistence farmer and now has around four acres of land where he practices mixed farming.  Price fluctuations and inflation, inadequate capital, and seasonality hinder his business. He desires to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car.
 
He hopes to diversify his business to include cattle keeping and to hire employees to expand his business.

loans.use: to hire employees to weed and harvest his crops.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en: Constance wants a loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, rice and salt to resell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She started by selling old clothes in the market, got capital, and started this shop. She desires to have a stable income and educate her children.  Inadequate capital hinders her business and her dream is to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, rice and salt to resell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey wants a loan to buy cows for rearing. He is a 28-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been rearing cattle for 4 years. Inadequate capital hinders his business and his dream is to own a ranch. He desires to educate children up to the university.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su pequeña hija, su madre y su esposo quienes la apoyan en su Pulpería, su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy accesible, ya que esta en la calle principal de su colonia donde vive, y esto hace que sea muy visitado, además que no tiene competencia. el crédito lo necesita para la compra de : maíz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, refrescos, arroz, verduras, aceite etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas crezcan, ya que comprara una variedad de producto, y así podrá contrarrestar la demanda de producto que le hacen sus clientes desde muy temprano de la mañana.
Los planes a futuro de Cinthia es hacer crecer su negocio, darle una buena educación a su hija y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Cinthia is a young woman living in southern Honduras. Her little daughter lives with her, and her mother and husband are the people who support her in her business. Her grocery store is in a very accessible location, since it is on the main street of the neighborhood where she lives, so it gets a lot of customers. Also, it doesn't have any competition.
She needs the loan in order to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausages, dairy products, soft drinks, rice, vegetables, oil, etc. She hopes the financing will allow her to increase sales, since she will be purchasing a variety of products so that she can meet her customers' demand, which begins very early in the morning.
Cinthia's plans for the future are to expand her business, give her daughter a good education, and have a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausages, dairy products, soft drinks, rice, vegetables, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a forty-two-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for ten years. His hardship is price fluctuations and inflation, his personal goals are educating his children and buying land. His business goal is hiring employees to help expand the business and venturing into mechanized agriculture. Deus wants money to buy fertilizers for his coffee and banana plantations.

loans.use: to buy fetilizers for his coffee and banana plantations.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29-year-old gentleman who is married with four children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda, and has run a retail shop for the past 10 years. Moses obtained the capital to open his store from two years spent working as a security guard in Iraq. His major business challenges are price fluctuations and inadequate capital.

Moses is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, and eggs to sell. In the future, he would like to educate his children and expand his business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 42-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal dream of educating his children to attain degrees up to the university. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and is facing a hardship of unpredictable weather conditions, which makes it hard to maintain the output of the farm yields. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and increasing his milk production by buying more cows. Richard needs the loan facility to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en: Nuriat is a hardworking married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the university. She is a farmer and is facing a hardship of unpredictable weather change, which is grossly affecting her output. She has a vision of diversifying her business to include a retail shop. Nuriat needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 3 months, he has operated a retail shop business. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Lucas dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. 

With the 25,000 KES, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transporting firewood.  

For the past two years, he has operated a charcoal and firewood business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition and the high cost of transportation in his business. 

With the KES 25,000, Emmanuel wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu,a Kiva partner, to access funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she will purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santos Elías

texts.es: Santos Elías de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto  a sus hijos en casa propia; Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y ya tiene varios años de pertenecer al rubro de los agricultores, se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le ha permitido en todo este tiempo obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno está ubicado en una zona con gran potencial agrícola, para la siembra y el comercio, él ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo el producto es de calidad y a buen precio además se caracteriza por ser servicial; Santos es un ejemplo de hombre, trabajador, entusiasta y activo le gusta aprovechar cada oportunidad que se representa, piensa que donde hay un negocio de éxito, alguien tomó alguna vez una decisión valiente, él quiere esa decisión por eso esta decido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos agrícolas semilla de maíz por mayor, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta etc., para que aumente la producción y obtenga mejores ganancias. Santos ya tiene experiencia crediticia y obtuvo buenas recomendaciones, por eso tiene la certeza que pagara el financiamiento con puntualidad, al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Elias, 32, lives with his kids in the home he owns. He has been in agriculture for a number of years and grows corn. His experience has been very valuable because it has allowed him to get the best harvests. His land is located in a zone with great farming potential, for both planting and commerce. He already has a lot of customers who know that his product is of good quality and at a good price. He is also know for providing great service. Santos is an example of a hardworking, enthusiastic and active man who likes to take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself. He thinks that where there is a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision. 

He wants to make such a decision, and for that reason is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy agricultural inputs - corn seeds in bulk, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc - so that he can increase his production and make more profit. Santos already has experience with loans and had good recommendations, which is why he is certain that he will make his payments on time. He hopes that he will be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds in bulk, fertilizer, insecticide and tools.

loans.name: Agustina Irene

texts.es: Agustina Irene de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, plátanos, pepinos, tomates, papas, chiles, aguacates entre otras, tiene ya varios años con este negocio y desde un principio se caracterizó por ser una excelente vendedora, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal frente a un comedor, tiene mucha clientela porque saben que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y siempre lo vende a precios accesibles; Agustina es una mujer de trabajo, honrada y responsable siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades, para ella las personas exitosas tienen extraordinaria persistencia, ahora que ha aumentado su demanda quiere invertir más para no decepcionar a la clientela por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar plátanos, chiles, papa, tomates, cebollas, pepino, aguacate, por mayor etc. Agustina Irene ya tiene experiencia crediticia y tiene buenas referencias de pago por eso tiene la certeza que responderá con el pago puntual del crédito, y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá ofrecer a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Agustina Irene, 57, lives with her life’s companion and her daughter.  She sells fruit and vegetables, bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes, potatoes, chilies and avocadoes, among others.   She’s been in business several years now and from the beginning has been noted for being an excellent seller.  

Her business is located in the municipal market across from an eatery.  She has many customers because they know that everything she sells is of very good quality and she always sells at affordable prices.  

Agustina is a working, honest, responsible woman who is always looking for new opportunities.  For her, successful people are extraordinarily persistent.  Now that demand has increased, she wants to invest more in order not to disappoint her clientele which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy bananas, chilies, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, avocadoes, etc. at wholesale.  

Agustina Irene already has loan experience and good payment references so she’s sure that she will be able to repay the loan punctually while at the same time she has the hope that she will be able to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old gentleman who has operated a salon for the past three years. He got his start-up capital with savings from working as a driver and also has a transport business. John has bought a car, but has not fully pay for it. His major business challenges include inadequate capital to facilitate his business, and high fuel and transportation costs.

John is requesting a loan to finish paying for his car. In the future, his goals are to educate his children through university and move his business to more permanent location.

loans.use: to complete paying for his car

loans.name: Las Escogidas 3 Group

texts.en:
Awilda lives in San Pedro de Macoris, in one of the most rural areas called Batey (a community surrounded by sugar cane fields). Awilda and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Las Escogidas 3 (the chosen). She requires a loan to buy underwear to sell by walking in her community and others nearby. 

Awilda is excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza International and in this group. She will take a step toward having one of her wishes come true — the one to invest in her business and establish it; she wants to be a underwear wholesaler and with this loan she will start to work for it. She is a young woman who wishes to study, become a professional, and to have a family. Awilda says that her favorite thing is to do business. She and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: To buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Ines Narcisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años el mismo que  estudian en colegio, dos  de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Nuestra amiga para salir adelante junto a su familia se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor, allí en su tienda ella también vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que así ha logrado sacar sola a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 12 años y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the communal bank Amistad meets every fifteen days. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of its inhabitants make a living farming and raising animals due to being an area with a lot of vegetation.

In this place we meet Inés who's 52 years old. She's divorced and from this relationship has three children. Two are of age and one is 15 years old who attends high school. Two of them still live with her.

Our friend makes a living doing business in order to get ahead with her family. She has a store in her home. There she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6am to 8pm, sometimes until later, and her children help her with her work. In her store she also sells all types of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery, and women's accessories). She's been doing this business for ten years and things are going very well for her as in this way she has been able to get her children ahead alone.

She is going to use this loan to stock up her store and buy rice, sugar, oils, all types of clothing, and Avon products. She's been part of the communal bank for twelve years and likes it because she began her business with one of the loans which today allows her to get ahead.

Her goals are to move forward and give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, clothing, and Avon products.

loans.name: Nancy Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual instala un pequeño kiosco en el centro de la ciudad, lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, también se desplaza hasta Bahía y calceta lugar en los cuales aprovecha los días de ferias ya que es cuando más personas llegan a estas ciudades y es cuando más vende. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Guayaquil y Quito cuando necesita para surtir su negocio. Tiene 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The “Amistad” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic; most of the inhabitants devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  It is an area with a lot of vegetation.

This is the place where Nancy, age 30, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have two children, ages 12, and 7.  One child goes to middle school, and the other attends primary school.  Her husband devotes himself to agriculture.

With the intention of earning something on her own account so that she is able to use it to get ahead, our friend sells all types of clothes.  To do this she set up a small kiosk in the center of the city.  A lot of merchants sell their products in this place, which extends to Bahía and Calceta.  She takes advantage of their fair days, which are the days when more people go to the cities.  This is when she sells more. 

When she needs to stock her business she goes to Guayaquil and Quito to buy her merchandise.  She has been doing this business activity for seven years, and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use the loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because she improves her business with the loans.  Her dream is to have a large place.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, pan, huevos, jabones entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en el lugar de su residencia y es muy conocido en la zona por ser el más surtido, se ha hecho de mucha clientela y las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad a precios accesibles además de un inigualable servicio; Daniel a pesar de la tienda también se dedica un poco al cultivo y le trae ganancias extras para el mantenimiento del hogar; Daniel es un hombre trabajador con muchas metas que desea alcanzar una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio quiere invertir más pero necesita ayuda de capital por eso se ha decidido solicitarle a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, pan, bebidas, jabones etc. Daniel tiene buenas recomendaciones crediticias, los créditos que ha obtenido han sido cancelados exitosamente, por eso se hace responsable de asumir el pago del financiamiento y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Daniel is 51 years old and lives with his life partner and their children in their own home. He owns a store where he sells basic need products such as basic grains, milk, bread, eggs, and soap among other items. His business is located in the same area as his home and he is well known there for having the best assortment. He has gained many customers and the people prefer him because he always has what they need. The products are of the best quality and are offered at affordable prices in addition to the unbeatable service. In addition to the store, Daniel also works a little in cultivation, which brings extra earnings towards maintaining the household.

Daniel is a hard-working man with many goals that he wants to achieve. One of these is to see his business grow. He wants to invest more but he needs help in the form of capital. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to buy basic grains, candy, instant products, bread, drinks, soap, and other items. Daniel has good credit recommendations. The loans that he has received have been successfully paid off. Therefore, he is responsible in making payments. At the same time, he hopes that he will be able to give his family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, instant products, bread, drinks, and soap

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.es: José Salvador de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la agricultura cultivo de maíz específicamente, tiene varios años en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia, el terreno está ubicado cerca de donde residen,  José vive en condición honrada y humilde, desde hace tiempo atrás su vivienda se ha ido deteriorando y hay un muro primordial que necesita de urgente reparación porque han comenzado las lluvias, pero no posee del suficiente capital para financiarlo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito donde le permita comprar materia prima, ladrillos, cemento, hierro etc. José Salvador es un hombre responsable, autentico y sobre todo muy trabajador, digno de admirar, piensa que el éxito no es para los que creen que lo pueden hacer, sino para los que lo hacen, tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias por eso tiene la seguridad que podrá cancelar la deuda con éxito y al mismo tiempo tiene la felicidad que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: José Salvador, 31, lives with his wife and their children.  He grows maize for a living, work that he's done for many years.  He and his family live in a house on the farm.  The small house has deteriorated over time and a main wall requires urgent repairs.  The repairs are urgent because the rains have started.  José is applying for an INTEGRAL loan because he doesn't have enough money for the repairs.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials: bricks, cement, rebar, etc.  José Salvador is a responsible man, hard-working and real.  He says that success isn't for those who think they can do something, but for those who really do.  We have reviewed his references and are confident that he can repay his loan in the agreed-upon time.  He says that he is happy to receive the loan because it will improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cleta

texts.es: Cleta, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, que se dedica al comercio informal, vendiendo tortillas en su casa. A sus 46 años de edad, Cleta está comprando una casa a través de un préstamo, mientras tanto, vive en un mesón con su nieta y su hija en condiciones muy sencillas, su hija ayuda con el negocio. Cada día, desde muy temprano Cleta debe cocer el maíz, ir al molino a moler el nixtamal, y luego iniciar la jornada de hacer las tortillas. Cleta necesita un crédito para la compra de materias primas como maíz, cal, leña, gas propano. Ella estima que podrá proveer el sustento diario a su familia, si obtiene un préstamo que le permita asegurar la compra de las materias primas para realizar su trabajo. Además ya que es una mujer muy comprometida con lo que se propone asegura que cumplica fielmente con el pago de su crédito
texts.en:
Cleta is a simple and hardworking woman, who is an informal trader, selling tortillas out of her house.  At the age of 46, Cleta is buying a house with a loan; meanwhile, she lives in a lodging house with her and daughter and granddaughter in very basic conditions.  Her daughter helps with the business. Every day, early in the morning, Cleta has to cook the corn, go to the mill to de-hull it, and then start her day making tortillas.  

Cleta needs funding to buy staples, such as corn, lime, and propane gas.  She estimates that she will be able to take care of her family's daily needs, once she obtains a loan that will allow her to be sure to be able to buy what she needs for her work.  Moreover, since she is very conscientious, she promises to pay her installments faithfully.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao, 52, is married with seven children, three of whom still attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice and sugar.

loans.name: Clara Esther

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Sociedad De Bahía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clara, tiene 63  años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  pero  de esa relación tienen cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun viven con ella al igual que un nieto que también es mayor de edad.

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios ingresos trabaja de conserje en una escuela de la localidad, pero además de eso ella en su casa tiene una pequeño local donde vende libros, útiles escolares, helados, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, su nieto le ayuda en este negocio cuando ella está en su trabajo, allí también tiene una pequeña bodega en la cual vende gas de uso domestico, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes necesitan comprar más que todo gas. Lleva 11 años con su negocio, el mismo tiempo que inicio en el Banco Comunal.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar gas, útiles escolares, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of Sociedad de Bahía Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its pretty beaches, its rich and varied cuisine, and the warmth of its people.  Here we met Clara, 63.  Her husband died several years ago, but she has six children from that relationship, all of whom are adults.  One of them still lives with her, as does her grandson, also an adult.

Our friend works as a custodian in a school in the town to have her own income.  In addition to this she has a small store in her house where she sells books, school supplies, ice cream, and telephone cards and recharge cards.  Her grandson helps her in this business when she is at work.  She also has a small grocery store where she sells gas for home use.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes until later if her customers need to buy anything, especially gas.  She has had the business for 11 years, the same time she has been with the communal bank.
 
She is going to use this loan to buy gas, school supplies, and telephone cards and recharge cards.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy gas, school supplies, cards, and telephone cards and recharge cards.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, camarones, pescados, conchas entre otros, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y se ha vuelto una excelente comerciante, su ventaja es que su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante lo que permite visitar diferentes zonas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles y fresco, recién sacado del mar o río, además el servicio es a la orden del cliente; Candelaria es una mujer visionaria con mucha motivación y entusiasmo por superarse, piensa que cuando nuestras actitudes sobrepasen nuestras habilidades, aun lo imposible se hace posible, ella tiene la idea de la posibilidad de invertir un poco más para mejorar las ganancias, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL crédito que le permita comprar camarones, conchas, pescado, etc. Candelaria tiene muy buenas referencias de pago, es responsable y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda con puntualidad, al mismo tiempo tiene la confianza que podrá llevar seguridad económica al hogar.
texts.en:
Candelaria, 53, lives with her life companion and their children.  She sells seafood: shrimp, fish and clams, among others.  She’s been in this business for several years now and she’s become an excellent merchant.  Her advantage is that she carries out her activity in an ambulatory fashion which permits her to visit different zones.  She has a large clientele because everything she sells is top quality and she sells it at affordable prices freshly caught in the sea or river.  Besides, her service is to customer order.

Candelaria is a forward-looking woman with much motivation and enthusiasm for self-improvement.  She believes that when our attitude surpasses our ability even the impossible become doable.  She has the idea of possibly investing a little more in order to improve profits but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy shrimp, clams, fish, etc.

Candelaria has very good payment references; she’s responsible and assures that she will be able to repay the loan punctually.  At the same time she trusts that she will be able to provide her home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos en casa propia, humilde pero estable, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, se siente orgulloso porque eso le ha regalado experiencia que le ha permitido obtener las mejores cosechas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precio accesible además de un excelente servicio; José es un hombre visionario con muchas ganas de salir adelante y cumplir todos sus sueños, piensa que el éxito es como un tren, todos los días pasa pero si no te subes tú, se subirá otro; en la última siembra perdió parte de la cosecha, debido a una tormenta grave, por eso hoy quiere recuperarse e invertir más pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herbicida etc. José Antonio tiene buenas referencias crediticias, y está seguro que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá cancelar el financiamiento con éxito y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio, 34, lives with his life companion and their five children in his own humble, but stable, house.   He grows corn and has been working in agriculture for several years.  He feels proud because it has given him experience that has allowed him to produce better harvests.  He’s attained a large clientele because they know that everything he sells is of first quality and he sells it at affordable prices and besides service is excellent.

José is a visionary man who very much wants to get ahead and make all his dreams a reality.  He believes that success is like a train.  It passes by every day but if you don’t climb on, someone else will.

He lost part of his previous crop due to a severe storm so he’d like to recuperate now and invest more but needs capital so he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

José Antonio has good credit references and he’s sure that with profits obtained he will be able to successfully repay the loan and at the same time will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Willman Josael

texts.es: Willman Josael, de 25 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño. Vive con su madre y sus dos hermanos al lado Oriente del país. Durante el tiempo en que Willman y sus dos hermanos se dedican a la siembra de maíz, yuca, arroz, pepino y otros cultivos,su madre se queda en casa, ella se encarga de los oficios domésticos. Willman es un joven sencillo y trabajador, responsable de ser el soporte económico de la familia. Cada año, gracias a los cultivos que trabaja, puede asegurar el sustento y bienestar de su familia. Por ello, Willman solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL que le permita adquirir semillas para la siembra, fertilizantes y otros insumos agrícolas, que le permitan cultivar maíz y yuca, con lo cual espera contar con trabajo para él y sus hermanos, y obtener los recursos necesarios para el bienestar económico de su familia.
texts.en: Willman Josael, 25, has worked on farms all his life.  He lives with his mother and two brothers in eastern El Salvador.  Willman and his brothers grow maize, yucca, rice, cucumbers and other crops.  Their mother works at household chores, taking care of her family.  Willman is a modest, hard-working young man who has taken responsibility for earning the family's living.  The farm provides a decent income and ensures that the family has what they need to live.  Willman is applying for an INTEGRAL loan so that he can buy seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural supplies for the next maize and yucca crop.  The money will allow him and his brothers to buy what they need to ensure the family's continued well-being.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Tomasa is a single mother with two children. She is the coordinator of her group El Samaritano ("The Samaritan") 3. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. She makes her home here in a simple house with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children alone, working and taking care of them. In the meantime, she enjoys doing business. 

Tomasa requires a loan to buy underwear, which she sell them in the house and by walking in her community and others nearby. She will sells to clients and to other sellers. She is planning in a short term to have a bigger inventory and to wholesale more quantities. Tomasa and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel a 36-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past seven years, he has been a farmer and has been able to provide for his family with his profits. Joel's major business challenges are price fluctuations, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital for his projects. 

Joel is requesting a loan to buy feed for his chicks. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into new areas and improve his poultry project. Personally, his goals are to educate his children and build a permanent residence.

loans.use: to buy feed for his chicks

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena se encuentra casada y tiene 6 hijos a quienes siempre les quiere brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que desde hace aproximadamente 25 años estudió en una academia de belleza el corte y cepillado del cabello, y desde entonces viene trabajando fuertemente para generar ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Anteriormente Luz Elena tenía su salón de belleza ubicado en un local y en el cual tenía muy buenas ventas, pero con el ánimo de cuidar a sus hijos menores decidió trasladar su salón de belleza para su casa, y allí aún conserva la clientela fija de su negocio. Gracias a que su salón de belleza lo tiene en su casa, Luz Elena ha logrado criar a sus hijos y brindarles una buena calidad de vida, por lo que sus hijos han logrado tener un apoyo en su hogar constantemente y Luz Elena quiere que su negocio siga funcionando desde su casa para seguir estando al cuidado de sus hijos. Con el ánimo de renovar algunas de sus herramientas de trabajo, Luz Elena busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar un secador y una plancha profesional y así renovar sus herramientas de trabajo para brindar a sus clientes un buen servicio en su salón de belleza.

De esta manera podrá seguir teniendo una buena cantidad de clientes brindándoles una buena atención en su negocio, y así sus ingresos seguirán aumentando. Además, Luz Elena espera que sus hijos y su esposo puedan seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is married and has six children for whom she always tries to provide a good quality of life. About 25 years ago, she studied at a beauty school and learned how to cut and style hair. Since then, she has worked hard to generate income in order to contribute financially to the household expenses. Luz Elena previously had a beauty salon at a location where she generated many sales. However, she was eager to take care of her young children, so she moved the beauty salon into her house. She was able to maintain an established clientele for her business. By having the beauty salon in her house, Luz Elena was able to look after her children and provide them with a good quality of life. She wants her children to have constant support at home, so she is willing to keep her business at home so that she can continue looking after them.

Luz Elena is looking forward to replacing some of her work equipment, so she is seeking a loan as an opportunity to purchase a hair dryer and a professional curling iron. By replacing her equipment, she will be able to provide good service to the customers who visit her beauty salon. By continuing to have a good number of customers and providing them good service, Luz Elena's earnings will continue to increase. She also hopes that her children and her husband will continue experiencing a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a professional curling iron.

loans.name: Yine Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yine, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 29, 2 3 y 18 años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en Universidad y dos de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias De La Educación y también aprendió corte y confección en un centro en la ciudad.

Nuestra amiga trabaja de maestra en un colegio de la localidad pero también tiene un taller de costura en su casa,  allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 en el colegio y de allí hasta 22h00 en su taller aunque a veces se queda hasta más tarde si tiene que entregar alguna prenda, tiene 10 años con su taller y gracias a Dios le va muy bien. Ella también confecciona los uniformes para el colegio donde labora con lo cual en esa temporada asegura mucho trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 9 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y seguir dando sus clases.
texts.en:
The “Amistad” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic, and most of the inhabitants devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.  It is an area with a lot of vegetation.

This is the place where we meet Yine, age 47.  She is married and they have three children, ages 29, 23, and 18.  The youngest child attends the university, and two of the children still live with her.  Her husband devotes himself to agriculture.   She has a degree in education, and she also learned dressmaking at a center in the city. 

Our friend works as a teacher at a local school.  However, she also has a seamstress shop in her house.  That is where she makes all types of clothes.  She works by orders from individuals who know the quality of her work.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. at the school.  Then she works until 8:00 p.m. in her shop.  Although, at time, she stays until later if she needs to deliver a garment.  

She has had her shop for ten years, and thanks to God, it is going very well for her.  She also makes uniforms for the school where she works.  This assures her of a lot of work during the school season.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.  She has been in her communal bank for nine years.  She likes it because the loans have a very low interest rate.  Her dreams are to have a larger shop and to continue teaching.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Crisel Yesenia

texts.es: Crisel Yesenia de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a sus hijos y su mama; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene prendas en variedad camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas entre otros toda muy novedosa, además vende otros artículos como peluches y juguetes de bebe, su local está ubicado en el mercado de la zona  y es muy conocida, tiene mucha clientela porque saben que en su  negocio siempre encuentran lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con producto de calidad, el servicio es excelente,  Crisel se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad; es una mujer decidida y muy trabajadora, siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades, piensa que el éxito no solo se logra con cualidades especiales, sino con elementos esenciales como la constancia y la organización; Crisel ha tenido buenos resultados con el negocio por eso se animó a invertir un  poco más pero necesita un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Crisel es responsable y tiene buenas referencias crediticias, sabe que  podrá cancelar el financiamiento con éxito y también tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Crisel Yesenia, 35, lives with her children and her mother.  She sells women’s, children’s and men’s clothes.  She has a variety of shirts, pants, dresses and blouses among others; all are very stylish.  She also sells other items like stuffed toys and baby toys.  Her stand is located in the local market and is very well-known.  He has many customers because they know that they will find what they need at affordable prices and of good quality in her store and besides service is excellent.

Crisel is noted for her great kindness; she’s a woman who is determined and very hardworking.  She’s always looking for new opportunities and she believes that success isn’t only attained with special qualities but with essential elements like constancy and organization.

Crisel has had good results with the store which is why she’s venturing to invest a little more but needs capital support which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy clothes at wholesale.

Crisel is responsible and has good credit references.  She knows that she will be able to successfully repay the loan and also has the hope that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariana Luz

texts.es: Mariana Luz de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una carpintería donde realiza junto a la ayuda de su hijo varón todo tipo de trabajos con madera, mesas, sillas, muebles, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y es muy conocido por las personas el lugar pues su trabajo es de excelente calidad y lo elabora al gusto del cliente además de los precios bajos; Mariana es una mujer activa, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le presenta pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, en las últimas semanas tuvo pérdidas con un material defectuoso y desea recuperarse, quiere invertir de nuevo  y aumentar la producción pero necesita de un apoyo de capital, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor, clavos, pintura, barniz, etc. Mariana Luz es de excelente paga tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias y está segura que podrá cancelar el financiamiento a tiempo, a la vez tiene la esperanza de ofrécele a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Mariana Luz, 47, lives with her children in their own house. She has a carpentry shop where, with her son's help, she makes all kinds of items from wood: tables and chairs, among other things. She has had the business for years and is well known by the local people because the quality of her work is excellent and she makes items that meet her customers' wishes at low prices.

Mariana is an active, enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She wants to take advantage of every opportunity that comes her way because she realizes this is the only way to succeed. In the past several weeks, she has taken losses on defective material and wants to make it up by reinvesting and increasing production; however, she needs capital. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy wholesale wood, nails, paint,  varnish, etc. Mariana Luz has a good credit history and good references and is sure that she will be able to make her loan payments on time. At the same time, she hopes to offer her family financial security.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood, nails, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Dolores Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
